txt.en: 'We're not interested in your excuses. We just want our money.'
'Look, you got a loan to buy seed for planting, now your harvest has come and gone with naught to show.'
'Here, I'll give you what I have. That will have to be enough for now.'
'We'll tell you what's enough. Either you turn over your lands as payment or the watch'll find you face down in a ditch.'
'But that farm has been in my family....'
'... the kingfisher and the skylark sang their cares away, from dawn until the dusk and on to break of day.'
'... the silly old hound would not speak, save but to bully or brag, yet when he'd spy his master's toes all a-woolly....'
''Cry uncle', I did say! And when he did, the treasure I grabbed and ran far away-away. I stole the treasure and ran far away.'
'... as the sun caressed the leaves and the wind blew in the rushes, I thought of you in the tired old hat....'
'... the lady of the house cried, 'Then you will go right back out and fetch me another!''
'... without warning, the lynx were upon them with the wily moonlight dancing in their cruel, cruel eyes.'
